de.linguatools.disco

Class Rank

  • java.lang.Object
    • de.linguatools.disco.Rank

  • public class Rank
extends java.lang.Object
    This class contains methods that are based on the rank a word occupies in the similarity list of other words.

    • Method Detail

      • rankSim

        public int rankSim(DISCO disco,
          java.lang.String w1,
          java.lang.String w2)
            throws java.io.IOException,
                   WrongWordspaceTypeException
        Computes the rank of w2 in the similarity list of w1. If w2 does not occur in the similarity list of w1, the return value is the highest rank + 1. (The highest rank is equal to the length of the list of similar words stored for w1. The default value is 300. See DISCOBuilder option -nBest.)
        If w1 is not in the index, 0 is returned.
        Important note: This method does not work with word spaces of type DISCO.WordspaceType.COL (use de.linguatools.disco.Rank.rankCol instead).
        Parameters:
        disco -
        w1 - input word #1 (must be a single token).
        w2 - input word #2 (must be a single token).
        Returns:
        rank (1...n) or 0
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException
        WrongWordspaceTypeException - if the disco word space is not of type DISCO.WordspaceType.SIM.

      • rankCol

        public int rankCol(DISCO disco,
          java.lang.String w1,
          java.lang.String w2)
            throws java.io.IOException
        Computes the rank of w2 among the collocations of w1. If w2 does not occur as collocation of w1, the return value is the highest rank + 1. If w1 is not found in the index, the return value is 0.
        See DISCO.collocations for more information.
        Parameters:
        disco -
        w1 - input word #1 (must be a single token).
        w2 - input word #2 (must be a single token).
        Returns:
        rank (1...n) or 0
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

      • highestRanking

        public java.util.ArrayList<Rank.WordAndRank> highestRanking(DISCO disco,
                                                   java.util.Set<java.lang.String> words,
                                                   DISCO.WordspaceType type)
                                                     throws java.io.IOException,
                                                            WrongWordspaceTypeException
        Finds the words in the index in whose similarity or collocation lists the words rank highest. There must be at least one word in words.
        For each word v from the vocabulary, the method looks up on which rank v occurs among the similar words or collocations of the words from the input set. The score of v is the product of these ranks. The lower the rank product, the more similar v is to words.
        For low frequency words this method often gives better results than de.linguatools.disco.similarWords().
        Warning: This operation is very time consuming! It should only be used if the word space has been loaded into main memory.
        Parameters:
        disco - DISCO word space (in-memory)
        words - set of input words (all words must be single tokens).
        type - If type is WordspaceType.SIM then the list of the semantically most similar words is searched, otherwise the list of significant co-occurrences (=collocations) is searched. Therefore, WordspaceType.SIM is only possible with word spaces of this type!
        Returns:
        ArrayList with similar words, most similar first. If none of the words was found in the index, the return value is null.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException
        WrongWordspaceTypeException
